score_adjustments.evidence: Cursor $500M ARR, Devin/Cognition $10.2B valuation, 85% developer adoption. Market consolidating into 3 leaders (Cursor, Copilot, Devin). Moat increasing for established players.

MA.rationale: Market consolidation (Cognition acquired Windsurf) increases moat for established code gen tools. Three leaders emerging with network effects.

CE.rationale: Evidence certainty further increased: Cursor $500M ARR is strongest single-product validation in AI coding

score_adjustments.evidence: Figure AI $39B valuation. Q1 2026: $2.26B robotics funding. Capital acceleration from digital→physical AI continues.

CE.rationale: Evidence certainty increased: Figure AI $39B and Q1 2026 $2.26B funding confirm physical AI capital rotation is accelerating, not speculative

score_adjustments.evidence: Model is middleware/software stack, not AV hardware. Fleet management SaaS layer more accessible than O-score of 47.5 suggests. Software companies funded at scale in adjacent logistics.

MO.rationale: Middleware positioning means MO should reflect software accessibility, not full AV hardware barriers. Fleet management and route optimization layers are software plays.

score_adjustments.evidence: GovTech procurement AI validated: Starbridge $42M, OpenGov $1.8B. Defense software layer accessibility confirmed by growing GovTech ecosystem.

CE.rationale: GovTech funding data further confirms defense software layer accessibility. Starbridge $42M and OpenGov $1.8B validate government SaaS model.

no_change_validations.verdict: FURTHER VALIDATED — $238B AI funding in 2025 confirms F4_capital enrichment is real
VALIDATED — AI agent infrastructure genuinely more necessary. 40% enterprise apps agentic by 2026 confirms infrastructure-first pattern.
FURTHER VALIDATED — Defense software accessible, platform locked. MC-V50-DEF-001 captures accessible layer correctly.
STRUCTURAL — Infrastructure scoring higher is real for defense, confirmed by $7.7B defense VC flowing to software/infrastructure.
NOT ADDRESSED — Insufficient data on education infrastructure vs business model scoring.
CONFIRMED BY DESIGN — TNS-O disconnection is structural feature, revalidated.

new_model_recommendations.name: Enterprise AI Voice Agent Platform
new_model_recommendations.rationale: Conversational AI $19.21B, VC 7x growth. ElevenLabs $3.3B, Giga $61M. Distinct vertical: contact center replacement economics with per-call pricing, BFSI/healthcare verticals, multilingual requirements.

new_model_recommendations.name: Domain-Specific Synthetic Data Generation Platform
new_model_recommendations.rationale: TAM $60-90B. 70% of AI training data by 2030. Domain expertise + HIPAA/GDPR compliance = moat. Enterprises pay $500K-$5M/yr. Synthesia $4B valuation validates space.

new_model_recommendations.name: AI Safety & Compliance Platform
new_model_recommendations.rationale: EU AI Act Aug 2026 mandatory compliance. Penalties €35M/7% turnover. Insurers requiring red-teaming. 175+ startups. Mandatory demand = highest SN possible.

new_model_recommendations.name: LLMOps & AI Agent Observability Platform
new_model_recommendations.rationale: WitnessAI $58M. Agent proliferation creates monitoring/governance need. Emergent infrastructure — similar to APM (Datadog) but for AI agents.

new_model_recommendations.name: Commercial Drone Inspection & Delivery Platform
new_model_recommendations.rationale: Zipline $7.6B, 2M+ deliveries. Commercial layer accessible. Regulatory progress enabling deployment. Distinct from military drone platforms.

new_model_recommendations.name: AI-Powered Government Procurement Platform
new_model_recommendations.rationale: Starbridge $42M, OpenGov $1.8B. GovTech fundability up 30%. Procurement automation = specific vertical SaaS with government buyer economics.
